title: Rogers leaving Washington State for Iowa State after one year in Pullman
text: After just one year, the Jimmy Rogers era at Washington State is over. Rogers is set to become Iowa State’s head football coach, the school announced Friday night. ESPN’s Pete Thamel first reported the news. Washington State went 6-6 in Rogers’ first year in Pullman — a bizarre transition year in which WSU had 75 new players, played schools from 10 different conferences ahead of the Pac-12’s expansion in 2026 and lost three road games to AP Top 25 opponents by a combined margin of 12 points. Defensive coordinator Jesse Bobbit, who also worked with Rogers at South Dakota State, will serve as the Cougars’ interim head coach, according to a source familiar with the situation. WSU is set to learn which bowl game it will play in on Sunday and will apparently prepare for the game without its head coach for a second straight year. Former WSU coach Jake Dickert left for Wake Forest about 10 days prior to WSU’s bowl game last year. Iowa State’s former coach Matt Campbell, the winningest coach in ISU history, is set to take the same position at Penn State, according to reports, which cleared the way for Rogers to ascend from FCS coach at South Dakota State to a Big 12 program leader — with an 11-month stop in Pullman — in less than one calendar year. “Iowa State has been one of the nation’s top programs for the last decade and we look forward to building upon its upward trajectory,” Rogers said in an ISU statement. “From the administration, to the alumni and current student-athletes, this university has everything needed to compete at the highest level in college football. I am honored to be given this opportunity and responsibility and cannot wait to get started.” Rogers agreed to a six-year deal with Iowa State. Terms of the deal were not immediately available. WSU hired Rogers on Dec. 28, 2024, the day after the Cougars lost the DirecTV Holiday Bowl game to Syracuse in San Diego. The deal that Rogers agreed to last year gave him $1.57 million per year through 2029. Now, WSU will seek to replace Rogers without a permanent athletic director. Last month, the university fired athletic director Anne McCoy after just 17 months on the job and named CFO Jon Haarlow as interim AD. The value of Rogers’ buyout was not immediately clear as of Friday night. Rogers has spent the majority of his football coaching career at his alma mater, South Dakota State, where he won two FCS national championships — one as defensive coordinator in 2022 and another in his first year as head coach in 2023. He was 27-3 in two seasons as the Jackrabbits’ head coach and will arrive in Ames, Iowa, with a 33-9 combined head coaching record over the past three years. Rogers brought the bulk of his assistant coaches with him from Brookings, S.D., to Pullman, including both coordinators and a slew of position coaches and staff members. He also welcomed 16 of his former South Dakota State players to WSU through the transfer portal and flipped a slew of players from his 2025 SDSU high school recruitment class. Seven of WSU’s eight leading tacklers, including starting safety Tucker Large and linebacker Caleb Francl, were either SDSU players or recruits. Under Rogers’ direction and Bobbit’s coordination, WSU was No. 18 in total defense per Pro Football Focus, with 303 yards allowed per game against one of the tougher schedules in the country. His staff took a unique shape from the get-go, with a youthful and innovative flavor. The staff included Kris Kracht, director of football mental performance. Rogers separated himself from his smiley predecessor with a distinctly stoic style. He prided himself on “telling the truth,” and his players — from those who stayed at WSU to those who followed him from Brookings, S.D., to those who transferred from elsewhere — praised him for that. “I’m about people and I’m about as loyal as it gets,” Rogers said in his introductory news conference in the Gesa Field suite in January. “I know that word has been thrown around here and people don’t want to hear it.” WSU welcomed 28 new players — 25 of them high school recruits — on Wednesday at the start of college football’s early signing period. In a Wednesday news conference, he detailed his approach to recruitment. “As you get to know him, you get to realize, ‘Are they a man of their word? Do they follow through? How do they treat people? Are they selfless? Do people in the school speak highly of them?’” Rogers said. “Because those things carry over to the football field, there’s no question about it.” Player reaction to the news was mostly optimistic on social media. Defensive ends Jack Janikowski and Donovan Fitzmaurice shared the same Bible verse on their Instagram stories, Proverbs 16:3: “Ask the Lord to bless your plans and you will be successful in carrying them out.” Tight end Trey Leckner, another Coug who endured Dickert’s pre-bowl game departure last year, posted “God got all us covered !! Trusting his plan,” on X (formerly Twitter). “Know that!” redshirt freshman linebacker Anthony Palano replied. Palano was one of 16 players to follow Rogers and his staff from SDSU to WSU. He earned a starting role at middle linebacker after Keith Brown missed the season with an injury and shared the spot with true freshman Sullivan Schlimgen. Since news of Rogers’ departure broke, no player has publicly announced plans to transfer, though that is likely to change. Three Cougars — including Potter and redshirt freshman cornerback Kenny Worthy III — are reportedly intending to enter the transfer portal. Worthy announced his intentions on his Instagram on Thursday. WSU has not released any public comment concerning Rogers’ departure as of press time. Taylor can be reached at 208-848-2268, staylor@lmtribune.com, or on X or Instagram @Sam_C_Taylor.
summary: Jimmy Rogers is set to become Iowa State’s head football coach . Rogers went 6-6 in his first year in charge at Washington State . The Cougars lost three road games to AP Top 25 opponents by a combined margin of 12 points .

title: Dear Abby: There can only be 1 queen of the castle, and husband’s spoiled daughter seems to be it
text: DEAR ABBY: I’ve been married to a wonderful man for five years. He has an almost-20-year-old daughter, “Amber,” whom he raised alone. Amber is spoiled and entitled because he overcompensated for the lack of a mother figure in her life. I get it. However, she continues to be disrespectful to me and has made him choose sides in disagreements. I’ve always tried to be neutral in situations. We all live together, but Amber and I just don’t get along. She doesn’t respect her father at all. When I have tried to make him realize it or support him when she’s being unruly, I am turned into the bad guy. I am not asking him to choose, but there is only one queen of the castle, and it isn’t me. What do I do? -- PRICKLY SITUATION IN GEORGIA DEAR PRICKLY: Is Amber in college and living at home? Is she employed but not earning enough to support herself? Where is her mother? How long is she going to be living with you? You and your “wonderful” husband could lessen some of the tension in your household if you start talking with a licensed marriage and family therapist. He should have stepped in the moment his daughter started acting out and insisted you be treated with respect (at the very least) as long as she is under his roof. Dear Abby is written by Abigail Van Buren, also known as Jeanne Phillips, and was founded by her mother, Pauline Phillips. Contact Dear Abby at or P.O. Box 69440, Los Angeles, CA 90069. Jeanne Phillips, also known as Abigail Van Buren, has written the advice column “Dear Abby” since 2000, responding knowledgeably with the wit and compassion that earns her the loyalty of millions of fans. She’s... more
summary: Dear Abby: I've been married to a wonderful man for five years . He has an almost-20-year-old daughter, "Amber," whom he raised alone . Amber is spoiled and entitled because he overcompensated for the lack of a mother figure in her life . She continues to be disrespectful to me and has made him choose sides in disagreements .

title: ‘Didn’t really feel fair’: Pat Cummins makes key reveal over ‘close’ Gabba selection call
text: Australian skipper Pat Cummins has declared his fitness for the Adelaide Test, revealing the team’s ultimate reason for precaution in Brisbane. The Aussies flirted with recalling the 32-year-old after a brisk recovery from his back injury, but Cummins spoke of not wanting to be “too cute” with team balance when it came to managing bowling loads. Speaking during the second session on Day 3, Cummins confirmed on Fox Cricket that “barring any hiccups”, he’d make a return at Adelaide Oval on December 17. Watch The Ashes 2025/26 LIVE and ad-break free during play with FOX CRICKET on Kayo Sports | New to Kayo? Join now and get your first month for just $1 > “First of all, yeah, I should be right for Adelaide,” he said on Fox Cricket. “So, I’ll have one more bowl tomorrow (Sunday), and then we’ll go to Adelaide and have another bowl there. “So, barring any hiccups, I’ll be good to go. Body feels great.” Asked by commentator Mark Howard how close he was to playing in Brisbane, Cummins said: “Relatively close, really. “Body feels great, I’m bowling at 100 per cent. The big question mark when coming back from a bone injury is we tend to have a bowl and have a couple of days off, recover, bowl, bowl. “I haven’t done back-to-back bowls, so one of the high-risk things going into a Test match is you’re going to be expected to bowl two days in a row, maybe three days in a row, and potentially quite a few overs.” The Australian skipper revealed the deciding factor in not making an earlier return. “So, we felt that (not doing back-to-back bowls yet) was too risky; we started to kind of game plan (for reduced overs) — could we try and maybe bowl 20 overs, 25 overs with ‘Greeny’ in the side as an all-rounder?” Cummins continued. “We feel like we’ve got lots of bowling. So, we really tried to map out a way where I could play, but it just felt a little bit too cute in the end. “And it didn’t really feel fair on the other bowlers, or even on myself as a captain. If I had to have a bowler that I was bowling and trying to work out which overs, it didn’t quite feel right … it didn’t feel like the right Test match to take that risk.” Cummins reinforced the Gabba’s seam-friendly surface, speaking similarly to Steve Smith ahead of the first day of the second Test when speaking on conditions. “One of the reasons you want to win the toss and have a bat is it gives you the chance to hopefully bowl in the night with a rock-hard ball, and maybe you can really pick and choose for the rest of the game where you can place your new-ball bowling to line it up with night-time,” he said. Cummins later added: “It also feels, as a bowler, and I’m not sure if the data backs this up, but it swings a bit more here in Brisbane, whether it’s more humid conditions than Adelaide.”
summary: Pat Cummins has declared his fitness for the Adelaide Test . The Aussies flirted with recalling the 32-year-old after a brisk recovery from his back injury . Cummins spoke of not wanting to be “too cute” with team balance when it came to managing bowling loads . The Australian skipper revealed the deciding factor in not making an earlier return .

title: 4-goal third period leads Kelowna Rockets to 5-3 win over Seattle
text: Published 8:04 am Saturday, December 6, 2025 By Jordy Cunningham Kelowna Rockets assistant captain Mazden Leslie scored a goal and added an assist in the team’s 5-3 win over the Seattle Thunderbirds on Friday, Dec. 5. (@Kelowna_Rockets/X) The massive third period is just what the doctor ordered as the Kelowna Rockets opened its seven-game road trip with a 5-3 win over the Seattle Thunderbirds on Friday, Dec. 5. After a scoreless first period, Seattle’s Antonio Martorana opened the scoring with his 15th goal of the season at the 4:58 mark of the second frame. Less than a minute later, Rockets captain Carson Wetsch responded with his eighth of the campaign, assisted by Mazden Leslie on the powerplay. Coster Dunn responded for the Thunderbirds with a shorthanded goal, regaining the lead. In the final minute of the middle stanza, Martorana scored his second of the period with the man advantage, making it 3-1. Vancouver Canucks 2025 first round draft pick Braeden Cootes assisted on the goal. The third period was all Rockets as Levi Benson, Wetsch, Dawson Gerwing, and Leslie all found the back of the net, leading to the 5-3 win. Gerwing’s fourth of the year at the 11:22 mark was the eventual game-winning goal. Rowan Guest collected an assist as well as Wetsch, giving him a three-point night. Gerwing also had a helper on Wetsch’s second goal of the game, which tied the contest. Leslie’s goal was an empty-netter to seal the deal while Shane Smith and Hayden Paupanekis also collected helpers. Josh Banini earned the win by stopping 33 of 36 shots faced. With the win, the Rockets leap-frog to fourth in the WHL’s Western Conference with a record of 13-9-3-1, sitting in a logjom with three other teams who also sit at 30 points on the year. Kelowna is back in action on Wednesday, Dec. 10 as they take on the last place in the WHL Swift Current Broncos (8-19-1-0) in Swift Current. Puck drop is at 5 p.m. Pacific time.
summary: Mazden Leslie scored a goal and an assist in Kelowna Rockets’ 5-3 win over the Seattle Thunderbirds on Friday, Dec. 5 . With the win, the Rockets leap-frog to fourth in the WHL’s Western Conference .

title: The pretty little seaside village surrounded by incredible winter walks
text: A gorgeous seaside village with scenic winter walks is the perfect place to spend a day exploring and enjoying a winter stroll. Charmouth, along the border of Dorset and Devon, boasts an abundance of footpaths and unspoilt countryside land with panoramic views of the English Channel. Harbouring a unique charm of seaside air, the village is an idyllic sanctuary for walkers who want a gentle pace and those hoping for a more uphill challenge. The South West Coast Path is the longest path in Britain, stretching all the way from Minehead in Somerset to Poole Harbour in Dorset. The journey can start in Charmouth, with an 83 mile walk across the astonishing coastline. Walkers can enjoy spectacular views of the far reaching coast and landmarks such as Durdle Door. It's a lengthy journey with a challenging route, so it’s recommended for more experienced walkers. Read more: The stunning winter walk that has been named the 'most scenic' in the UK Read more: The pretty European city that’s one of Europe’s most walkable – best in winter We use your sign-up to provide content in ways you've consented to and to improve our understanding of you. This may include adverts from us and 3rd parties based on our understanding. You can unsubscribe at any time. Read our Privacy Policy For walkers with less experience, a stunning footpath walk along the riverside could be the perfect alternative. Along the idyllic River Char, a winding path with stretches of wildflower meadows will take walkers from the centre of Charmouth to Wootton Fitzpaine. The route is only a mile and a half long, making it a quintessential journey to admire the West Country nature. Charmouth Beach has become famous across the world for its fossil hunting. Over 250 specimens of fossils have been found and placed in museums. The cliffs are eroding over time, meaning new fossils of ancient reptiles and dinosaurs. It’s just a two minute drive or an eight minute walk to the UNESCO World Heritage site, Jurassic Coast. At 95 metres long, it’s the perfect place for geological findings with the coastline boasting a remarkable collection of rocks and fossils. Further down the coast, Lyme Regis is just an eight minute drive or an hour’s walk away. The stunning seaside resort is known as the ‘Pearl of Dorset,’ with breathtaking scenery and a picturesque harbour. Visitors were keen to praise their trips to the village on TripAdvisor. One wrote: “Visited the beach on an overcast day. Loved the heritage centre, very informative and interactive. The beach itself was clean and accessible, as you approached you heard the tap tap of stones and hammers looking for fossils.” Another admired the village’s beauty. They wrote: “Beautiful beach always beautiful, come wind, rain, or shine, Charmouthis beautiful. I love looking for fossils and exploring the area.”
summary: Charmouth, along the border of Dorset and Devon, boasts an abundance of footpaths and unspoilt countryside land . The South West Coast Path is the longest path in Britain, stretching from Somerset to Poole Harbour in Dorset . Walkers can enjoy spectacular views of the far reaching coast and landmarks such as Durdle Door .

title: Clever reason Royal Mail workers always wear shorts even in winter
text: Forget how cold the UK is right now, our Royal Mail workers are still wearing shorts! Regardless of the weather conditions, you'll find posties just love dressing like it's still summer, but it turns out there's an explanation to it all. Following a query on Reddit, somebody questioned whether it was an official regulation or silly tradition handed down through time. As it happens, the reasoning is quite straightforward – and rather clever. The post asked: "Postmen/woman of the UK, why do you wear shorts all year round?" Whilst another post posed the identical question. So what's the reason behind it? Thankfully, the queries encouraged Royal Mail workers to respond, revealing it's a combination of getting hot on the job and a little bet. One stated: "It really is just because it gets hot doing the job. One round I wear trousers just because of the wind but it's that particular village happens to be the highest point of the town and is a massive wind tunnel. All other rounds I'm in shorts pretty much all year." Another in the profession commented: "The depot had a running bet where everyone paid £1 a week into a pot, with the winner got to give the entire fund to a charity of their choice. "The competition was to see who could go furthest into the winter in shorts. As the snow kicked in during January it was down to two die hards. Eventually as spring kicked in it was deemed a tie, the pot was split between the two, raising several hundred each. "At the end of the competition a supervisor also added to the pot out of his own pocket and both got a free cooked breakfast from the work's canteen for a week in recognition of their efforts!" A third individual confessed: "Skin is waterproof. Walking all day is hot work." In another comment, a user claimed: "Skin dries faster than trousers when it rains, they get in and out the van a lot and at my father-in-law's post office depot, anyone that doesn't show up in shorts has to put a quid in the jar." One Reddit user wrote: "Same reason footballers are still wearing shorts playing in freezing rain. Once you're burning a certain number of calories you don't feel the weather at all." Speaking about posties, one person remarked: "Seen a few today in shorts. I admire their stealth." However, it's believed that in severe conditions some delivery workers do resort to wearing waterproof trousers. So next time you spot your postie strolling around in shorts in the freezing cold, just know they've had a busy day!
summary: Reddit user asked Royal Mail workers why they wear shorts all year round . The post asked: "Postmen/woman of the UK, why do you wear shorts?" So what's the reason behind it? Thankfully, the answers were answered by a Royal Mail worker . He said: "It really is just because it gets hot doing the job"

title: When a cluster of bees counts as central heating
text: The first seriously cold week of the season and here I am shivering in my backroom office and paying first-of-the-month bills. In spite of the chill, it’s kind of nice to do these regular tasks, like paying bills and changing the calendar to the last month of the year. It’s been a year and a half since I retired and I have found that it’s easy to slip into the kind of relaxed mode I was in when I was a teenager — meaning, things get done if and when they get done. That’s the whole purpose of becoming an adult: You start cleaning up your act and becoming responsible so you can hold down a job, raise a family and make enough money to begin therapy. I’m not a big fan of winter, but it does tend to focus one’s attention. Isn’t that what they also say about standing in front of a firing squad? Winter requires some forethought about how to keep warm, how to stay fed and how to prevent every pipe in your house from freezing into an icicle so you don’t have to call the plumber and try to bribe him into coming to your house to fix them, which is futile because all the other bozos who failed to winterize their house got to him first. I love that joke about the lawyer who hired the plumber to come to his house and when he got the bill, the lawyer exclaimed: “Geez, even I don’t make this much money!” and the plumber replies: “Neither did I, when I was a lawyer.” I tell this joke to my lawyer son and he doesn’t laugh. My sister, who is such a good gardener, came to help me clean up the backyard to get ready for winter and she noticed that there were a lot of dead bees in front of the hive on my back patio. It’s normal, I explained. Bees don’t live long, anyway, and in the winter some of them die and the ones inside the hive kick out the bodies. But even though it looks bad, dead bees in front of your hive are actually a good thing because it means there are still live bees inside. When you stop seeing dead bees on the ground that could be a sign of trouble, such as, they’re all dead inside. Winter is the time all of us beekeepers wring our hands in hopes that the colonies will get through the winter. Beekeepers take pains to winterize their hives just as homeowners do to their houses, although you don’t have to worry about frozen pipes in a bee hive. Bees don’t hibernate but they do form a tight cluster in the center of the hive box and rotate from the inside to the outside of the cluster to stay warm. I’ve read that the inside of a honey bee hive stays around 98 degrees in the winter, which is pretty amazing considering there’s no wood stove. Although I suppose you could consider that cluster of bees central heating. And there’s a lesson in that, of course. We all stay warmer when we stick together. Honey bees survive by eating the honey they’ve stored up over the past year. Many beekeepers augment their bees’ food by providing candy boards or some other form of sugar in case the bees’ stores run low. I’ve never done that but I think it’s a sweet gesture to give bees candy over the holidays. And then comes spring when the bees emerge from their winter igloo and get busy collecting nectar and honey and resuming their vocation in life to make more honey. Which I collect later on in the summer and put into a jar and then when the cold winter comes back again, I spoon some out into a steaming hot cup of tea. It’s an exchange of gifts. Hedberg may be contacted at khedberg@lmtribune.com.
summary: In spite of the chill, it’s kind of nice to do these regular tasks, like paying bills and changing the calendar to the last month of the year . Winter requires some forethought about how to keep warm, how to stay fed and how to prevent every pipe in your house from freezing into an icicle . Even though it looks bad, dead bees in front of your hive are actually a good thing because there are still live bees inside .

title: Gonzaga rolls past Kentucky
text: NASHVILLE, Tenn. -- Graham Ike scored a season-high 28 points and had 10 rebounds as No. 11 Gonzaga routed No. 18 Kentucky 94-59 Friday night on a neutral court that felt much more like Rupp Arena South with Wildcats faithful filling Brigestone Arena, home to the NHL's Nashville Predators. Gonzaga (8-1) notched its third Top 25 win this season and third over a SEC team, all by double digits. The Bulldogs had been off since being routed by then-No. 7 Michigan on Nov. 26 in Las Vegas. Braden Huff added 20 points for Gonzaga, and Adam Miller and Braeden Smith each had 11. Gonzaga never trailed, scoring the first seven points. The Bulldogs jumped out to a 19-2 lead and extended it to 25 points. Kentucky's blue-clad fans booed the Wildcats (5-4) off the court at halftime, when they trailed 43-20. Gonzaga kept padding its lead in the second half. When Huff's bucket with 3:57 left made it 86-53, fans headed for the exits. The Bulldogs led by 37 inside the final minute. NO. 5 UCONN 83, EAST TEXAS A&M 59 STORRS, Conn. -- Solo Ball scored 10 of his 14 points in the second half, Eric Reibe had 13 points, 6 rebounds and 3 blocks and No. 5 UConn beat East Texas A&M. Alex Karaban added 12 points, and Braylon Mullins scored all 10 of his points in the second half. UConn (8-1) shot 61% from the floor in the second half. Ball and Reibe combined for UConn's first 12 points in the second half to help the Huskies go up by 16 points. Gianni Hunt answered with back-to-back three-pointers. However, Mullins had seven points and Alex Karaban added six points during UConn's 17-3 run. Ronnie Harrison had 15 points and six rebounds for East Texas A&M (4-4). TOP 25 WOMEN NO. 25 WEST VIRGINIA 97, MERCYHURST 51 MORGANTOWN, W.Va. -- Jordan Harrison scored 19 and West Virginia cruised to a victory over winless Mercyhurst. Harrison made 6 of 10 shots with 3 three-pointers and all four of her free throws for the Mountaineers (7-2), who snapped a two-game slide. She added five assists and three steals. Carter McCray totaled 15 points on 6-for-7 shooting off the bench, adding seven rebounds for West Virginia. Kierra Wheeler totaled 14 points, 8 rebounds and 5 steals. Sydney Shaw added 13 points and six assists, while Gia Cooke scored 12. Reserve Sofia Wilson had 14 points to lead the Lakers (0-8), who fall to 0-5 on the road. Erica Hall scored 13 on 5-for-6 shooting.
summary: No. 11 Gonzaga routs No. 18 Kentucky 94-59 in Nashville, Tennessee . Gonzaga notches third Top 25 win this season and third over a SEC team, all by double digits . No. 5 UConn beats East Texas A&M 83, 83; West Virginia beats Mercyhurst 97 .

title: Samsung Galaxy S26: First render images found in One UI 8.5 beta
text: It has already been well established how the Samsung Galaxy S26, Galaxy S26 Plus and Galaxy S26 Ultra will eventually look thanks to numerous leaks over the past few weeks and months, even though there is still some uncertainty regarding the exact thickness of the base model, which was reportedly changed at the last minute. That being said, some more or less unspectacular render images have now been discovered directly in Samsung’s code, or in a current One UI 8.5 test version to be more exact. According to Android Authority, the four images below show the rear design of three new Samsung flagships with the code names M1, M2 and M3. The first refers to the Samsung Galaxy S26, while M2 is likely the Samsung Galaxy S26 Plus and M3 the Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra. As we reported separately today, a leaked magnetic power bank for the Galaxy S26 series suggest that the Samsung smartphones will finally be equipped with built-in magnets, which means that no case is needed for proper usage of Qi2 accessories. Thus far, only the HMD Skyline and four Google Pixel 10 flagship phones offer this practical feature. Android Authority, Winfuture, Wireless Power Consortium Images: TT Technology, Youtube
summary: Four images show the rear design of three new Samsung flagships with the code names M1, M2 and M3 . The first refers to the Samsung Galaxy S26, while M2 is likely to be the Samsung S26 Plus and the S26 Ultra . The images were discovered in a test version of the One UI 8.5 test version .

title: Arne Slot reaction — 'A sense of unbelief' from Liverpool manager after latest dropped points
text: Arne Slot knows nothing's coming easy for Liverpool this season, and that's starting to feel proverbial after the Reds threw aside 2-0 and 3-2 leads in a 3-3 draw with Leeds at Elland Road on Saturday. That makes it two draws in four days against newly-promoted sides for the defending champions. Slot's men had been held into the second half, but Hugo Ekitike remedied that with two quick goals right after the break. MORE — Leeds v Liverpool recap, video highlights A funny thing happened on the way to a comfortable win, however, as Dominic Calvert-Lewin converted a controversially-awarded penalty and Anton Stach made it 2-2 late in Beeston. Fortunately for Slot, Dominik Szoboszlai continued to deliver a Liverpool player of the year campaign with an 80th minute answer. Unfortunately for Slot, Ao Tanaka had an answer in stoppage time. How did Slot see things? How do you feel? "A sense of unbelief. I think we played quite well to very well in large parts of the game. I don't think we conceded a chance until we made a foul which is not even a chance and they get a penalty through VAR intervention. 2-1 and then the first chance they have is 2-2. We go up and then you think you've done enough to win the game but then a set piece." "It's not about me. It's about us, about the fans, about the players. To concede a set piece again, I think it's 10 or 11 this season, you can't be higher on the table than us. To go away at 3-3, I don't think that's what we deserve." "We concede goals without the other team having a chance. It's so difficult to play a game of football if you don't concede a chance and one goes in. We can only look at ourselves because we are the ones who are doing it. That's the situation."
summary: Liverpool held 2-0 and 3-2 leads in 3-3 draw with Leeds at Elland Road on Saturday . Arne Slot knows nothing's coming easy for the defending champions this season . "A sense of unbelief. I don't think that's what we deserve," says Slot .

title: Letter: As a community, let’s put books in children’s hands
text: To the editor, This year, I joined with the Community Foundation of Grand Forks, East Grand Forks and Region to bring Dolly Parton’s Imagination Library to Grand Forks County. This incredible program, which sends free books to children every month until their fifth birthday, echoes a value I learned on our family farm: Books are the foundation for a strong future. ADVERTISEMENT My dad, a stoic, Norwegian-blooded farmer, wasn’t much for conversation. But he knew a sure-fire way to connect with his daughter was through books. Many nights, when he wasn’t harvesting, he would read me stories, exploring the worlds of the Berenstain Bears and Richard Scarry. These moments with my dad allowed us to bond. They sparked my love of reading and showed me how characters navigated challenges with compassion. We have an opportunity to ensure every child in Grand Forks County can have those same moments, no matter their income. We can send them a book every month, straight to their home (from Niagara to Northwood), to spend their most formative years immersed in storytelling. We can develop the next generation of leaders who enter kindergarten with an enthusiasm for learning and an ability to connect. Regular access to books is crucial to building a child’s language, critical thinking and reading skills. In fact, research from the Dollywood Foundation finds 90% of brain development occurs in the first three years of life, when a baby forms over 1 million neural connections per second. Books can’t wait until kindergarten. The opportunity I had as a child is possible for all with Imagination Library. But we need the support of local partners to make it happen. We’ve set a goal of $90,000 to initiate Imagination Library, a goal we’ll need to sustain annually. It’s a large investment, but a necessary one. If you believe that books can change a life’s trajectory, please consider partnering with us to bring Imagination Library to Grand Forks County. To learn more, contact the Community Foundation directly at communityfoundation@gofoundation.org. Kaylee CusackGrand Forks ADVERTISEMENT ADVERTISEMENT
summary: Dolly Parton's Imagination Library sends free books to children every month until their fifth birthday . The program echoes a value I learned on our family farm: Books are the foundation for a strong future . 90% of brain development occurs in the first three years of life, research finds .

title: Soccer-Leipzig dismantle Frankfurt 6-0 with Diomande hat-trick
text: Soccer Football - Bundesliga - RB Leipzig v Eintracht Frankfurt - Red Bull Arena, Leipzig, Germany - December 6, 2025 RB Leipzig's Yan Diomande celebrates scoring their third goal REUTERS/Lisi Niesner LEIPZIG, Germany, Dec 6 (Reuters) - RB Leipzig teenager Yan Diomande became the second youngest player in Bundesliga history to score a hat-trick when he netted three times in 18 minutes in their 6-0 demolition of visitors Eintracht Frankfurt 6-0 in the Bundesliga on Saturday as they tightened their hold on second spot in the Bundesliga. The 19-year-old Ivory Coast internationalbagged his goals between the 47th and 65th minutes to take his season tally to six league goals. Only Frankfurt’s Walter Bechtold was younger when he scored his hat-trick in November 1965. Conrad Harder put the hosts in the driving seat after five minutes, timing his run perfectly to head the ball over Eintracht keeper Michael Zetterer, who came charging out of his goal. Frankfurt hit the crossbar with Mo Dahoud's stunning shot from 20 metres out but Leipzig hit them on the rebound, immediately launching a quick break, with Harder cuttingback for Christoph Baumgartner to tap in their second goal after half an hour. Diomande then took over, scoring twice before David Raum made it 5-0 with a 62nd minute penalty. The teenager completed his maiden Bundesliga hat-trick with another superb finish three minutes later. Leipzig are on 29 points in second place, eight behind leaders Bayern Munich, winners 5-0 at VfB Stuttgart. Third-placed Borussia Dortmund, on 25, are in action against Hoffenheim on Sunday. (Reporting by Karolos Grohmann, editing by Pritha Sarkar) Thank you for your report!
summary: Leipzig teenager Yan Diomande becomes second youngest player in Bundesliga history to score a hat-trick . The 19-year-old Ivory Coast international netted three times in 18 minutes in their 6-0 win over Eintracht Frankfurt . The hosts tightened their hold on second spot in the Bundesliga with the result .

title: Four Of Family Killed In Kishtwar Mishap
text: Date Srinagar- At least four members of a family, including a six month old infant, were killed in a road accident in the Dada Sarthal area of Kishtwar district on Saturday, officials said. Officials said that a Chevrolet vehicle (registration number DL5CE 5634), travelling towards Drabshalla, skidded off the road and plunged into a gorge. Three persons died on the spot, while another critically injured passenger was rushed to a nearby hospital, where she was declared dead on arrival. The deceased have been identified as Ranjeet Singh, 35, son of Poran Chand; his wife Jyoti Devi, 30; their infant daughter Ashu, aged six months; and Simran Thakur, 21, daughter of Om Prakash. All were residents of the Marmat area of Doda district. Police have registered a case and initiated an investigation to ascertain the cause of the accident. The deceased have been identified as Ranjeet Singh, 35, son of Poran Chand; his wife Jyoti Devi, 30; their infant daughter Ashu, aged six months; and Simran Thakur, 21, daughter of Om Prakash .

title: A Difficult First Year Due To Terror Attacks: CM Omar
text: Date Srinagar- Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Saturday said his first year in office has been“a difficult one” owing to major terror attacks, while sharply questioning the Union Territory governance framework for sidelining the elected government in security matters.Speaking at the Hindustan Times Leadership Summit in New Delhi, Omar said those claiming terrorism had ended in the region were ignoring ground realities. He insisted there was no“return” of militancy because it had never fully vanished. “Why do you use the word return? When did it ever go away? It was there,” he said.“The changes made to the constitutional relationship between Jammu and Kashmir and the rest of India are not going to miraculously result in an end to terror.” The chief minister referred to the April 22 attack in Baisaran, Pahalgam and the November 10 blast in Delhi, saying those who believed everything was normal after 2019 were taken by surprise. Omar warned that the recent terror incidents have pushed the country to a point where any future strike“will be considered an act of war”, making preventive action even more critical. He criticised the existing governance model under Union Territory status, saying elected representatives are excluded from key security discussions.“You cannot operate governments in silos. Elected representatives play no part whatsoever in decisions affecting security,” he said. Omar drew a contrast with his earlier tenure as chief minister, when he received immediate updates from senior police and security officials.“I read about the Delhi blast in a newspaper. I did not know who carried out the attack or how the investigation was proceeding,” he remarked.“The Union Territory model does not work.” MENAFN06122025000215011059ID1110446826 MENAFN06122025000215011059ID1110446826 Legal Disclaimer: MENAFN provides the information “as is” without warranty of any kind. summary: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah said his first year in office has been a difficult one . He sharply questioned the Union Territory governance framework for sidelining the elected government in security matters . Omar said those claiming terrorism had ended in the region were ignoring ground realities .

title: Pahalgam Attack, Nowgam Blast: SDRF Awards 4 Civilians
text: Date Srinagar- The Jammu and Kashmir State Disaster Response Force (JKSDRF) on Saturday felicitated four civilians for their exemplary bravery and swift rescue efforts during two recent incidents in the Valley, including the Pahalgam terror attack earlier this year and the accidental blast at Nowgam police station last month.The felicitation took place in Srinagar as part of the 63rd Raising Day celebrations of Home Guards and Civil Defence. Among those honoured was Nazakat Shah, a resident of Anantnag district, who bravely rushed to save a tourist family in the aftermath of the April 22 terror attack in the Baisaran meadows of Pahalgam. Three residents of the Nowgam locality in Srinagar - Wahid Jeelani Dar, Shabir Ahmad Wani, and Shabir Ahmad Bhat - were also recognised for being the first responders after the November 14 accidental blast at the Nowgam police station. Their quick action helped rescue police personnel in danger, officials said. Commendation certificates and cash rewards of Rs 10,000 each were presented to the four civilians by Commandant General Home Guards, Civil Defence and JKSDRF, DIG (Civil Defence and SDRF Kashmir) Imtiyaz Hussain Mir. “These civilians put their own lives at risk to save others. Their courage and humanity deserve the highest appreciation,” Mir said. In addition to these awards, several Civil Defence wardens and volunteers were also honoured with commendation certificates and cash rewards of Rs 5,000 for exceptional performance in training, awareness, and rescue activities. Officials said the recognition aims to encourage community participation in emergency response and promote a culture of timely assistance during crises.
