summary: The Jammu and Kashmir State Disaster Response Force (JKSDRF) felicitated four civilians for their exemplary bravery and swift rescue efforts during two recent incidents in the Valley . Nazakat Shah, a resident of Anantnag district, bravely rushed to save a tourist family in the aftermath of the April 22 terror attack in the Baisaran meadows of Pahalgam . Three residents of the Nowgam locality in Srinagar were also recognised for being the first responders after the November 14 accidental blast at Nowgam police station .

title: Tower of London closed after protesters attack crown jewel case
text: By Natascha Rivera • Published: 06 Dec 2025 • 21:06 • 3 minutes read Activists smeared food on the Crown’s case, triggering arrests and disruption. Photo Credit: Take Back Power THE TOWER of London was swiftly closed to the public shortly before 10:00am on Saturday, December 6 after a glass case of one of the centrepieces of the attraction, the Imperial State Crown, was smeared with food by protesting activists. The four protesters, who claimed to be from the “nonviolent civil resistance” organisation Take Back Power, threw apple crumble and custard onto the glass display case, leading to their immediate arrest, according to the Metropolitan Police. Take Back Power claimed responsibility for the attack on its social media account, and released images on its social media showing activists removing foil from a tray of cake and throwing it against the glass case. Another protester poured what later turned out to be custard on the glass as well. “Democracy has crumbled. Billionaires buy political influence whilst homeless people die on the streets,” reads their Instagram post. “We need a House of the People to tax the rich.” Following the protest, activists were shown wearing t-shirts with the slogans “democracy has collapsed,” and “Britain is broken, we are standing before the jewels of the nation to retake power.” According to Take Back Power, which appears to be an offshoot of British environmental activist group Just Stop Oil, the aim of the incident was to demand that the British government create a permanent citizens’ channel with legislative power, a so-called “People’s House,” which aims to tax the extremely wealthy and fix the country’s social situation. According to the organisation, the country faces a crisis of democratic representation, hence their slogans. The protesters were arrested on suspicion of criminal damage, according to a statement released by the Metropolitan Police, who collaborated with the City of London Police. The detainees remain in custody and an investigation into possible structural damage to the display case is ongoing. The Tower of London was evacuated and closed to the public to facilitate an assessment of the damage and cleanup of the food. The exhibition of the jewels will remain on pause until the assessment is complete. A possible link to other organised protests is also under investigation. The Tower of London, an emblematic fortress and historical heritage site of not only the city but the whole of the UK, houses several valuable pieces including the Crown Jewels. The Imperial State Crown, which was housed in the attacked case, was forged in 1937 for the coronation of George VI, and still remains a principal symbol of the United Kingdom, often used at events including King Charles III’s coronation in 2023. The Imperial State Crown is made of 2,868 diamonds, 17 sapphires, 11 emeralds, four rubies, and 269 pearls, and weighs more than one kilogram. It is preserved as part of the Royal Treasury, alongside various other pieces. The attack marks an unprecedented event and has sparked widespread concern about security protocols at one of the city’s most visited attractions. The incident was an unwelcome reminder of the recent large-scale security failure in France, the Louvre robbery in October of this year, in which thieves were able to enter the Louvre and steal €88 million worth of jewels, baffling and humiliating French authorities. Though the situations differ greatly in that the protesters had, as it is understood, no intent to steal any of the artifacts, the parallels are enough to make residents question whether security in an important national monument like the Tower of London is adequate. The Metropolitan Police did not rule out further measures to improve security at the site. Read more news from the UK here. Share this story Subscribe to our Euro Weekly News alerts to get the latest stories into your inbox! By signing up, you will create a Euro Weekly News account if you don't already have one. Review our Privacy Policy for more information about our privacy practices.
summary: The Tower of London was swiftly closed to the public shortly before 10:00am on Saturday, December 6 after a glass case of one of the centrepieces of the attraction, the Imperial State Crown, was smeared with food . The four protesters, who claimed to be from the “nonviolent civil resistance” organisation Take Back Power, were arrested .

title: At least 3 killed, 6 wounded in explosion in western Mexican state of Michoacan
text: 07/12/2025 Share: Share Story MEXICO CITY, Dec 7, (AP): An explosion outside a local police station in the western Mexican state of Michoacan Saturday killed at least three people and wounded six, local and federal security officials said. The explosion came as the federal government has stepped up security activities in the state, sending in additional troops after two recent high-profile assassinations. The Attorney General's office said in a statement that a vehicle exploded on a central avenue in Coahuayana. "The driver died at the scene, while two other people died in the regional hospital, and six others were injured," it said. The two people who died in the hospital were community police officers, said Hector Zepeda, commander of the Coahuayana community police. He said the remains of some of the victims were found scattered in the area of the explosion, which also damaged nearby buildings. "With this operation (from the federal government) a lot of marines came,” Zepeda said. "We stopped doing patrols because the operation is going on.” The community police, which patrol various rural communities, are a remnant of the civilian vigilante forces that took up arms more than a decade ago to defend communities from drug cartels, and then were formalized by the state. Coahuayana is near the Pacific coast in western Michoacan and the border with the state of Colima, a stronghold of the powerful Jalisco New Generation Cartel. Saturday’s explosion happened while Michoacan Gov Alfredo Ramírez Bedolla was in Mexico City to celebrate with President Claudia Sheinbaum the anniversary of their Morena party’s arrival in power seven years ago. Ramírez Bedolla and Sheinbaum have been criticized for the deteriorating security situation in Michoacan where numerous drug cartels are fighting to control territory, terrorizing locals. At least three of the six drug cartels that the Trump administration designated as terrorist organizations - Jalisco New Generation, United Cartels and The New Michoacan Family - operate here, in addition to a slew of homegrown armed splinter groups, some supported by the Sinaloa Cartel. Explosives dropped from drones, buried as mines or planted alongside roadways are increasingly employed by criminal groups operating in the state. Last year, some 3,000 explosive devices were seized in the state compared to 160 in 2022. So far this year, there have been more than 2,000, according to the state security agency. Share Story
summary: An explosion outside a local police station in the western Mexican state of Michoacan killed at least three people . The explosion came as the federal government has stepped up security activities in the state, sending in additional troops after two recent high-profile assassinations .

title: Asking Eric: After 6 years sober, man is frustrated by his family’s hold on their hurt and distrust
text: Dear Eric: I’ve just turned 40 this past year. The last 15 years I was in a horrible drug addiction. I lied and hurt and did terrible things to a lot of people, especially my family. About eight years ago they officially disowned me. Understandable. I’ve cleaned up and got my act together six years ago. At first, I tried to force my way back into their lives, which all refuted. I lashed out, said horrible things and stopped trying to be in their lives. My mom will stop by on my birthday for 10 minutes or so and drop a card off at Christmas. As for my two older brothers and my father, it’s radio silence. I guess what I’m asking is, what do I do to fix this and fast, as I said I’ve turned 40 this year, my parents are both 70. Time is running out, and I couldn’t imagine living my life without some kind of acceptance from my father. Or knowing he did or does love me. My heart breaks at the thought, but this is a real pickle. How can I fix a problem when the ones I need to fix it with won’t talk to me? Do I just keep ignoring their existence and put on this façade that I don’t care to my wife and 4-year-old son? What picture am I painting to my son, as he’s been guilty by association you could say as he has never spent time with his grandparents or uncles or even my nieces and nephews? – Discombobulated Dear Discombobulated: There’s a saying in some recovery communities – perhaps you’ve heard it – time takes time. This means that you accumulate sober days one at a time; there’s no fast track to long-term recovery, unfortunately. Similarly, there is no fast track to healing years of hurt and distrust. This can be hard to accept. It may feel like you’re trapped in your old self and your old actions. But you have to accumulate days in your new way of life one at a time, too. If you’re in a recovery program, like Narcotics Anonymous or SMART Recovery, keep working it. Talk to your sponsor or peer support group about your desire to make amends to your relatives and mend those relationships. Ask yourself if you’ve fully acknowledged and apologized for the things that you did during active addiction. If not, a letter doing so is a good place to start. I know this causes you a lot of pain, and possibly shame. But you’re not your past and you’re not the worst things you’ve done. Let your wife know what you’re really feeling. Continuing to put up a façade will only hurt your relationship and could endanger your sobriety. Tell the truth. That’s how things change, little by little. Send questions to R. Eric Thomas at eric@askingeric.com or P.O. Box 22474, Philadelphia, PA 19110. Follow him on Instagram and sign up for his weekly newsletter at rericthomas.com. R. Eric Thomas (he/him) is a national bestselling author, playwright, and screenwriter. His memoir, Here for It, or How to Save Your Soul in America, which Lin-Manuel Miranda hailed as “pop culture-obsessed,... more
summary: The last 15 years I was in a drug addiction and my family disowned me . I’ve cleaned up and got my act together six years ago . At first, I tried to force my way back into their lives, which all refuted . My mom will stop by on my birthday for 10 minutes or so and drop a card off at Christmas . As for my two older brothers and my father, it's radio silence .

title: 'MobLand' season 2 faces off-screen rift between Helen Mirren and Tom Hardy
text: December 07, 2025 MobLand season 2 is shaping up to be just as intense behind the scenes as it on the screen. According to insiders, the relationship between Dame Helen Mirren and Tom Hardy is ‘extremely strained’ on the set of Paramount+ show. Reportedly, Mirren who plays the sharp and commanding Maeve Harrigan is said to be frustrated with Hardy’s laid-back approach. Crew members have described him as occasionally distracted and even late to shoots. The 48-year-old is reportedly found at times playing games on his phone. Such behavior clashes with Mirren’s reputation for professionalism and discipline. A source shared the actress is ‘getting increasingly frustrated’ with attitude. As per an insider, “Tom’s character is charming. He’s the calm one but it is quite the opposite when the cameras stop. Dame Helen is a joy, she is a total pro and she has worked with so many people over the years.” “But she is getting increasingly frustrated with Tom and his attitude. He can be late to filming too and that is annoying for Dame Helen, who is extremely professional and disciplined.” “She expects better. She holds people to a high standard. She’s 80. She’s been there and seen it all,” the insider continued. The friction has made their working relationship difficult. Observers say Mirren no longer looks comfortable filming scenes with him, and the tension has become personal rather than purely professional. This isn’t the first time Hardy’s intensity has caused issues. During the filming of Mad Max: Fury Road too, he famously clashed with Charlize Theron.
summary: The relationship between Dame Helen Mirren and Tom Hardy is ‘extremely strained’ on the set of MobLand season 2 . Crew members have described Hardy as occasionally distracted and even late to shoots . The 48-year-old is reportedly found at times playing games on his phone . The friction has made their working relationship difficult .

title: Lewiston’s ‘flying car’ has vanished — but will return
text: The classic car that spent 25 years perched on a pole outside of Wayback Cafe in Lewiston has vanished in seemingly mysterious fashion. But it will be back. The car, a 1954 Chevrolet 150 sedan that is painted blue with distinctive pink flames, was purchased recently by Lori and Kevin Williams, of Deer Park. In late October, the couple and some of their friends carefully removed the car from its lofty spot, loaded it onto a trailer and drove it back to their home north of Spokane. But Kevin Williams, a self-described “car nut,” plans to have the ’54 Chevy back in Lewiston this coming summer. “We made a promise to the previous owner that the car would be at Hot August Nights this next year, running and driving,” Williams said in a phone interview with the Lewiston Tribune. “And it’ll be the same paint job, same wheels, new tires. We’ll have it at Hot August Nights 2026, for its first debut as a running car in over 25 years.” Williams, 60, was familiar with the car as an occasional customer of Wayback Cafe. After more than a quarter-century in business, the ’50s-themed cafe was closed this past spring by owner Theresa Rivers. In the fall, Williams spotted an online ad that showed Wayback’s “flying car” for sale. Over the years, he has owned a few Chevy 150s — a no-frills cruiser that is more rare than similar Chevy models from the same era like the 210 or Bel Air — and it’s one of his favorite cars. For prospective buyers of the cafe’s high-flying mascot, there was a catch: They had to find a way to get it down from the pole. So Williams recruited a few friends — one of whom was a mechanic who figured out how to unbolt the car, and one of whom had a telehandler that could hold the car and lower it to the ground — and they completed their mission Oct. 28. During the operation, Lori Williams noticed something even more unusual than the flying car — a vintage Sheriff Big Mac jail, the kind of which was seen at McDonald’s playgrounds in the ’70s and ’80s. The Williamses decided to buy that too. Williams, who is retired from a career in business management, declined to say how much he paid for his vintage items, but said the price was “very, very reasonable.” The crew got Sheriff Big Mac loaded into the back of the couple’s pickup, which was also towing the flying car. During their subsequent stops in the valley and on their trip home, their strange cargo drew many gawkers. “We were the spectacle driving through town,” Williams said. “When (other cars) passed us, they were waving and smiling and taking pictures, and we had people that solicited us to stop so they could take pictures. ... It was nice to see so many people happy about this goofy McDonald’s Sheriff Big Mac and the flying car all together on a trailer going down the highway.” Williams plans to install Sheriff Big Mac in his backyard for his grandchildren during the warmer months, and keep it in storage during winter. As for the car, he’s wasting no time. He replaced the suspension, seats and wiring with items he had in stock, and is determined to have the Chevy ready for a car show in Spokane in the spring. Despite being exposed to the elements for so long, the car’s body is “solid,” Williams said. No rust, no holes, no damage. He plans to repaint it, but with the same design and color scheme as it now has. “That car is currently in my shop and on a lift. It’ll spend the rest of its life in a nice warm shop.” Williams is also working out a deal to acquire more memorabilia from Wayback Cafe’s time in business, which started in 1997. He’s hoping to purchase the restaurant’s V-shaped sign that is also perched on a pole 20 feet above the ground. He plans to create a “hangout spot in my shop to kind of pay homage to the Wayback Cafe and some other cafes that we’ve visited.” All of these efforts are Williams’ attempt to preserve historical items. “I love history, and when things change, I always had that sense of loss. There’s obviously people that thought that car was cool and liked the whole idea of that car flying above Lewiston for as long as it has. ... And I think it’ll be quite cool to bring that thing back to the valley as a running, driving car and have it in a car show.” Baney may be contacted at mbaney@lmtribune.com or (208) 848-2251. Follow him on X @MattBaney_Trib.
summary: The 1954 Chevy 150 sedan spent 25 years perched on a pole outside of Wayback Cafe in Lewiston, Washington . The car was purchased recently by Lori and Kevin Williams, of Deer Park . The couple and some of their friends removed the car from its lofty spot, loaded it onto a trailer and drove it back to their home .

title: 'Easy to blend' £8 Rimmel highlighter called 'tube of magic' as users rave about glow
text: Party season has officially kicked off and Superdrug customers are flocking to one glow-enhancing product that's garnering five-star reviews. Rimmel London's Multi Tasker Turbocharged Glow Liquid Illuminator, now priced at £8, is available at Superdrug. This viral highlighter is hailed by fans as a 'little tube of magic' that imparts a 'really healthy glow', making it perfect for daily wear or special occasions. As a versatile makeup item, the liquid illuminator provides adjustable radiance, making it suitable for both day and night wear. Designed for use on both face and body, it's part of Rimmel's new 'Glow Up Showdown' range. It aims to celebrate futuristic shimmer and all-out glamour for the festive season. The illuminator comes in nine shades: Chelsea Glow, It's Giving Bronze, Main Character, Not A Basic B, It's Giving Glow, Rosy Rebel, Iconic As Usual, Spilling The Tea and Bougie Girl - all of which can be used as a highlighter, blush or bronzer. The formula is enriched with Vitamins C and E to help hydrate the skin, while its lightweight texture ensures easy blending and layering. The soft touch wand allows for precise application, and the fragrance-free, vegan and cruelty-free formula makes it suitable for a wide variety of skin types. Lifestyle influencer Kim Mann has also shared her newest makeup bag essential on Instagram. LookFantastic is stocking the highly-rated ICONIC London Illuminator for £32, which boasts an impressive 4.8 out of five star rating, reports Wales Online. The product is available in nine shades Available in four shades - original, blush, glow and shine - it can be blended with 'foundation, moisturiser or primer to create a customisable glow', the website states. Meanwhile, Sephora offers the YVES SAINT LAURENT Touche Éclat Le Stylo Highlighter Pen 2.5ml for £32, which comes in various shades. This pen is designed to conceal dark circles, under-eye bags and redness, and can also be utilised for contouring and sculpting. Shoppers of the Rimmel illuminator have given it glowing reviews on the website. One customer commented: "I love this little tube of magic! It's a beautiful colour and so easy to apply and blend without looking too harsh. I actually use it as a highlighter and also as a liquid eyeshadow, which I think is great." Another reviewer added: "I'm usually quite boring with my makeup and don't use highlighter very much. I actually really like this shade, and it blends really well with my skin tone. "I think it gives you a really healthy glow and is quite subtle. I think it would actually be good for everyday wear or special occasions." Some customers expressed concerns about the product's longevity. One customer shared: "This product leaves a nice shimmery glow on my skin, and the texture is lightweight. I find that it doesn't last very long, though. It is still a good product, so I will continue to use it." However, the majority of feedback was indeed positive. Another satisfied customer stated: "The packaging is very cute and the applicator wand is handy for applying accurately and the right amount. The glow is very shimmery and pretty. It looks amazing on the skin and can be used as a blush or a highlighter."
summary: Rimmel London's Multi Tasker Turbocharged Glow Liquid Illuminator, now priced at £8, is available at Superdrug . Available in nine shades, it can be used as a highlighter, blush or bronzer . The formula is enriched with Vitamins C and E to help hydrate the skin .

title: ANALYSIS: Final grades for the Idaho football offense
text: The hype around the Idaho Vandals’ offense at the start of the season was like getting a new car. A completely new play-caller, a new quarterback under center and many fresh weapons on the outside caused excitement. In the end, it turned out to be a pretty disappointing season for the Vandals as they finished with an overall record of 4-8 and a 2-6 mark in Big Sky Conference play. Idaho coach Thomas Ford Jr. was unhappy with the results the offense was putting out on the field, so much so that he demoted offensive coordinator Matt Linehan from playcalling duties following the 28-14 UC Davis loss on Nov. 8. Linehan and Idaho “mutually parted ways” on Nov. 25, according to a Linehan X post. Idaho also decided not to bring back running backs coach Lance Dunbar to the coaching staff. The Vandals were No. 8 in the Big Sky in scoring offense, averaging 25.2 points per game. In total offense, they also ranked No. 8 in the Big Sky with 377.2 yards per game. Here are the final grades for Idaho’s offensive position groups after the season: Quarterbacks: B- It was a decent season for sophomore quarterback Joshua Wood in his first full season as a starting quarterback. He had a few games where he looked very explosive through the air and on the ground, and in others, he failed to get the ball moving much in the passing game. Wood finished No. 7 in the Big Sky with 1,898 passing yards and threw for 14 touchdowns and just five interceptions. Wood finished No. 10 in the Big Sky in rushing yards with 589 yards and seven touchdowns with a long of 59 yards on 86 carries, averaging 6.8 yards per carry. When the Vandals were without Wood for the two games he missed due to a lower-body injury, it was quite noticeable. The offense turned the ball over often in the Vandals’ 49-33 loss to Northern Colorado, and could not score very efficiently in the 21-14 loss against Eastern Washington. Without Wood, the Vandals’ offense couldn’t function, and they would have had a much worse year if he missed more time. Running backs: C+ Whenever your quarterback is leading your team in rushing yards, that points out an issue with the run game. Senior running backs Nate Thomas and Elisha Cummings were second and third in rushing on the team, respectively. Thomas rushed 109 times for a gain of 453 yards and three touchdowns, averaging just 41.2 yards per game. Cummings was injured for multiple weeks. However — except for against Portland State when he gained 65 yards on the ground and 100 through the air, and then against Northern Arizona with 106 yards rushing and 78 yards receiving — he had a tough year. Cummings totaled 71 carries for 365 yards and just two touchdowns. He averaged 36.5 yards per game. Sophomore running back Art Williams was having the best year of all the running backs until he sustained an injury before the Montana game on Sept. 27. He totaled 297 yards on 60 carries and two touchdowns, averaging 72.8 yards per game before he missed the rest of the season with an injury. With the problems that the running backs were having, it makes sense to move on from running backs coach Dunbar. Offensive line: A- This offensive line group was stout. They were the bright spot for the Vandals’ offensive unit all season and the most consistent group on either side of the ball. They ranked No. 4 in the Big Sky in sacks allowed at 17 for a loss of 118 yards, but some of that came with Wood holding on to the ball for an extended period of time because his wide receivers were not getting open right away. The rushing attack was No. 4 in the Big Sky in total rushing yards. The ground game averaged 175.4 rushing yards per game and scored 18 touchdowns. The group of left tackle Charlie Vliem, left guard Nate Azzopardi, center Layton Vining, right guard Leon Evans and right tackle Kiegan Henson proved to be one of the best offensive line units that the Vandals have had in recent seasons. Part of that has to do with the coaching of offensive line coach and run game coordinator Loren Endsley. Wide receivers and tight ends: C- This was the weakest part of the Vandals’ offense. The receivers and tight ends barely contributed at any significant level for most of the season. There were two receivers that had a “breakout” type of season, but due to injuries, their seasons were shortened. Sophomore receiver Ryan Jezioro looked like he was Wood’s No. 1 target at the beginning of the season. Through the first five weeks of the season, he put up 284 yards on 20 catches and caught three touchdowns. Since Week 5, he only played in four games and added 63 yards on seven more catches and one more touchdown. Freshman receiver Marquawn McCraney came on late in the season and was second on the team with 306 yards on 22 catches. He hauled in two touchdown passes. No other receiver really stood out. Senior tight ends Chance Bogan and Jake Cox barely contributed. Bogan had 13 catches for 107 yards, and Cox had 11 catches for 98 yards and two scores. Overall offense: C+ The offense deserves somewhere in the Cs. But I went with a C+ solely because the offensive line brought the group up so much. Also, because I think that a fully healthy Wood for the entirety of the season could have helped the Vandals to a better record. But it didn’t turn out that way. The offense was stagnant and couldn’t score many times when it mattered most. A massive shift will have to come in the offseason with the skill position groups and especially a big scheming change will have to happen for the group to excel next season. Junt can be reached at 208-848-2258, tjunt@lmtribune.com or on X (formerly Twitter) @TrevorJunt.
summary: Idaho finished with an overall record of 4-8 and a 2-6 mark in Big Sky Conference play . The Vandals were No. 8 in the Big Sky in scoring offense, averaging 25.2 points per game . Offensive coordinator Matt Linehan was demoted from playcalling duties after UC Davis loss .

title: Here's how Netflix's Warner Bros. acquisition poses risks to theatre industry
text: December 07, 2025 Netflix's recent announcement to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery has surely sent the streaming world into a frenzy, but the industry that could be hit the hardest is the theatre. This unease is evident in Warner Bros. Discovery’s film studio and streaming service falling under the belt of Netflix. As Netflix is emerging victorious in a bidding war against Paramount, Skydance and Comcast, concerns are mounting over the future of theatrical releases. Industry experts have raised an alarm at the adverse implications of this impending acquisition. Shawn Robbins, the director of analytics at Fandango, noted that many theatre owners view this outcome as unfavourable, fearing significant changes to the theatre industry. Cinema United, the largest exhibition trade association, also voiced strong opposition, warning that the deal poses an unprecedented threat to theatres of all sizes, estimating that around 25% of the annual domestic box office would be removed if the deal takes place. The biggest concern surrounding the Netflix-Warner Bros. merger is in Netflix's business model, which prioritises streaming over theatrical releases. Therefore, executives are worried that this could lead to fewer film productions for cinemas and shorter theatrical windows, further curtailing box office revenues. Past trends indicate that studio consolidations led to a decrease in theatrical releases, a pattern seen when Disney acquired 20th Century Fox. Although Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos has assured that Warner Bros. films will continue to be released in theatres, the specifics of these releases remain unclear, leaving the industry in uncertainty about whether these films will enjoy traditional theatrical windows or be limited to brief runs to meet award eligibility. As the deal comes to a close, theatre operators appear frightened of the implications, hoping Netflix will honour its commitments while fearing the long-term effects on their business model.
summary: Netflix is set to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery's film studio and streaming service . Concerns are mounting over the future of theatrical releases . Industry experts have raised an alarm at the adverse implications of this impending acquisition .

title: Marks and Spencer, Aldi and Lidl to close all stores for 1 day
text: The festive season is well underway as December progresses, and attention is already shifting toward Boxing Day traditions once Christmas passes. With only 20 days to go until the 26th, high streets are set to fill with shoppers chasing seasonal deals and picking up extra supplies. Whether it’s restocking after Christmas dinner or grabbing the usual bread and milk, multiple visits are likely before the month ends. As many of us are aware, supermarkets nationwide often adjust their regular opening hours for Boxing Day, with some choosing to open later, while others remain closed entirely to give staff a well-deserved break. To ensure no one finds themselves without essential items this year, we've compiled the confirmed opening hours for supermarkets across the UK during Boxing Day. Read more: I tried mince pies from Tesco, Sainsbury's, Asda, Waitrose and more Read more: Cheapest supermarket for Christmas dinner named Tesco stores will open on Boxing Day from 9am until 6pm, while Express branches are scheduled to trade slightly longer, from 9am until 7pm. According to Insider Media, "Tesco opening hours over the festive period from Christmas to New Year's Day vary depending on the store and its location". Sainsbury’s supermarkets plan to open on Boxing Day between 9am and 6pm, and their convenience stores will remain open later, running from 9am until 9pm. However, the official website warned: "Our opening times over the bank holiday, will vary dependent on each store." Aldi will not open any of its stores on Boxing Day, giving staff the entire day off. Rebecca Heley, Communications Director at Aldi UK, said: “Christmas is a special time, and we want to ensure all of our colleagues have the opportunity to relax and enjoy it with their loved ones. That’s why all Aldi stores will be closed on Boxing Day this year." We use your sign-up to provide content in ways you've consented to and to improve our understanding of you. This may include adverts from us and 3rd parties based on our understanding. You can unsubscribe at any time. Read our Privacy Policy Lidl stores will also remain fully closed on Boxing Day, with no branches operating that day. A spokesperson from Lidl shared: "Most stores will also remain closed on Boxing Day and New Year’s Day, but customers are encouraged to check their local store's opening hours on the online store finder or through the Lidl Plus app." Asda is set to open on Boxing Day, with stores trading from 9am until 6pm. Co-op stores will open on Boxing Day from 10am to 7pm, and their convenience sites will operate from 9am to 7pm. The store stated: "During bank holidays and special times of year some of our stores may open later and close earlier than normal." Waitrose will not open any of its main stores on Boxing Day, although a small number of Welcome Break and Shell-linked locations may continue trading. Marks and Spencer will keep all of its stores closed on Boxing Day. According to the Guardian, Jayne Wall, operations director for M&S, said: "Christmas at M&S is very special and we are grateful to our hardworking colleagues who make our stores great places for our customers to shop. "Like most retailers, we always have some colleagues in our stores and depots on Boxing Day to help reset. However, this year we will have more colleagues working than previously so we are in great shape to welcome customers on December 27.” Morrisons is expected to follow last year’s Boxing Day pattern, with stores in England and Wales likely opening from 9am to 6pm, and Scottish branches operating from around 8.30am until 6.30pm.
summary: Tesco stores will open on Boxing Day from 9am to 6pm . Sainsbury's and Express branches will trade slightly longer, running 9am until 7pm . Aldi will not open any of its stores, giving staff the entire day off .

title: Sudan’s army intercepts RSF drone attack on civilian facilities in Blue Nile state
text: KHARTOUM, Sudan/ISTANBUL The Sudanese army intercepted a drone attack by the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) that targeted civilian service facilities in Ad-Damazin, the capital of Blue Nile state, authorities said on Sunday. The Blue Nile state government said in a statement that the armed forces repelled an RSF attempt to target civilian infrastructure in the city, describing the RSF as a “terrorist militia.” It condemned “in the strongest terms” the drone attack and the rebel group’s attempt to strike the city’s power station, without providing details on casualties or damage. The power station is a vital public facility relied upon for having access to water and operating hospitals, dialysis centers and neonatal care units, the statement added. The attack reflects a “clear disregard for the lives of civilians and their humanitarian needs,” it added. Authorities reassured residents that the “situation is under control,” adding that the Sudanese army is fulfilling its duty to maintain security and stability, protect lives and property, and prevent efforts to drag the country into chaos. There was no immediate comment from the RSF on the attack. Earlier Sunday, the non-governmental Emergency Lawyers group said RSF drones targeted Ad-Damazin’s main power station Saturday, causing a total blackout and disrupting water supplies. Sudanese authorities have recently accused the RSF of carrying out a series of drone attacks on civilian facilities, including power stations and infrastructure, in northern and eastern cities. The group controls all five Darfur states out of Sudan’s 18 states, while the army holds most of the remaining 13 states, including the capital, Khartoum. The civil war between the Sudanese army and the RSF, which began in April 2023, has killed thousands of people and displaced millions of others. Anadolu Agency website contains only a portion of the news stories offered to subscribers in the AA News Broadcasting System (HAS), and in summarized form. Please contact us for subscription options. Source link
summary: Sudanese army intercepts drone attack by paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) Rebels targeted civilian service facilities in Ad-Damazin, the capital of Blue Nile state . Civil war between the army and the RSF, which began in April 2023, has killed thousands .

title: Drunk North East woman shouted racist abuse at student Subway worker before stealing crisps
text: A drunk woman shouted racist abuse at a student sandwich shop worker before making-off with packets of crisps. Julie Lowery walked into the Durham City branch of Subway late one evening in June before launching into a tirade of racist slurs. Fearful that the 43-year-old would try and get behind the counter, the shaken staff member called the police, which prompted Lowery to pick up packets of crisps and walk out without paying, magistrates heard. Lowery, of Pattinson Gardens, in Gateshead, has now been hit in the pocket after she pleaded guilty to a racially-aggravated public order offence and shop theft. Brian Payne, prosecuting at North Tyneside Magistrates' Court, said Lowery and a male entered Subway at around 11.30pm on June 9 this year. The pair of them asked the staff member to call the police as Lowery had a cut to her lip, however, the request was refused. Mr Payne added: "The man left but this defendant went berserk and started screaming. The worker says this: "I was worried she would come behind the counter as she screamed "ring the police". She came right up to the counter. "She then shouted p**** b****** at me several times. I was distressed by this and felt intimidated as I have never seen this aggression before"." In a statement, the victim said: "I was shaken up for the rest of my shift by what happened and I won't forget the incident for a long time. I was just trying to do my job to pay for my studies." The court heard that Lowery had an extensive criminal record and was last convicted of shop theft in 2024. Nick Moore, defending, said Lowery had spent most of her adult life living on the streets. He added: "On this occasion, she was living in Durham City and attended Subway after being the victim of an assault by another homeless individual. She asked them to call the police and they refused to do so. "Out of frustration, she lost her temper and said some harmful words and helped herself to some crisps. She is remorseful and there is a guilty plea." Lowery was fined £120 and must pay £85 costs and a £48 victim surcharge. We have a dedicated newsletter for court news and updates. It’s free and you can sign up to receive it here. It will keep you up to date with all the latest court cases and sentence updates from around the North East. ChronicleLive has created a dedicated WhatsApp community for court and crime news. You can join this WhatsApp community here. It will keep you up-to-date with Newcastle Crown Court, Durham Crown Court and crime news as it breaks, sent directly to your phone.
summary: Julie Lowery, 43, entered the Durham City branch of Subway late one evening in June . She asked staff member to call the police as Lowery had a cut to her lip, however, the request was refused . Staff member called the police, which prompted Lowery to pick up packets of crisps and walk out without paying . Lowery pleaded guilty to racially-aggravated public order offence and shop theft .

title: Coup Attempt: ECOWAS Deploys Standby Force in Benin
text: Michael Olugbode in Abuja The Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) Commission has deployed a standby force in Benin Republic to forestall breakdown of law and order and safeguard constitutional democracy. The deployment followed the unsuccessfully attempt by a faction of the military to oust President Patrice Tallon in the early hours of Sunday. A group of soldiers had early on Sunday appeared on Benin’s state television claiming to have ousted President Patrice Talon from office and dissolved all state institutions. The coup attempt began in the early hours of Sunday, with an attack on President Patrice Talon’s official residence in the capital Porto-Novo. The French Embassy had also said on X that “gunfire was reported at Camp Guezo” near the Talon’s home and advised French citizens to remain indoors for security. In their television appearance, the soldiers allegedly led by Lieutenant Colonel Pascal Tigri – then read out a statement, declaring they had removed the president from power. “The army solemnly commits to give the Beninese people the hope of a truly new era, where fraternity, justice and work prevail.” The loyal military group later rallied round the president to ward off the threats of the dissidents soldiers and kept democracy alive. The Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) in early release condemned the attempted military takeover of government in Benin Republic In the first statement, the regional bloc said: “ECOWAS Commission has received with consternation reports of an attempted military take-over in the Republic of Benin. “ECOWAS strongly condemns this unconstitutional move that represents a subversion of the will of the people of Benin. “ECOWAS calls for the full respect of the Constitution of Benin and salutes the efforts of the Government and the Republican Army in bringing the situation under control. “ECOWAS holds the leaders of the plot both individually and collectively responsable for any loss to life and property occasioned by their action. “ECOWAS will support the Government and the people in all forms necessary, including the deployment of the regional standby force, to defend the Constitution and the territorial integrity of Benin.” Nigeria government also condemned the military incursion in a statement issued by the spokesperson of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Kimiebi Ebienfa. The statement read: “The Government of the Federal Republic of Nigeria has received with grave concern and unequivocally condemns in the strongest possible terms the attempted forcible seizure of power in our friendly neighbour and brotherly nation, the Republic of Benin in the early hours of Sunday 7th December, 2025. “This act of destabilization represents a direct assault on democracy, constitutional order, and the collective will of the Beninese people, who have consistently demonstrated their commitment to peaceful political transitions. “Nigeria stands in firm solidarity with the Government and people of the Republic of Benin, and applauds the swift action taken by Beninese authorities to protect its legitimate institutions and preserve the peace.” “We commend the courage and professionalism of the Beninese security forces in defending the constitutional order and guaranteeing the safety of the President. Their dedication ensured that the unfortunate attempt to subvert democracy was decisively repelled,” the statement added. The statement further read: “Nigeria reiterates its strong commitment to the principles of democracy, good governance, and the rule of law as fundamental pillars for peace, development and regional stability. Unconstitutional changes of government are an unacceptable and retrogressive step that threatens the hard-earned democratic gains and socio-economic progress of our sub-region. “As a steadfast partner within the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) and the African Union, Nigeria calls on all member states and the international community to unite in condemning this act and in reaffirming our shared commitment to the African Union’s Charter on Democracy, Elections and Governance, and the ECOWAS Protocol on Democracy and Good Governance. “We urge all parties in the Republic of Benin to remain calm, uphold the rule of law, and continue to channel any political discourse through peaceful, constitutional, and democratic means. “The Federal Government of Nigeria reassures the Government of the Republic of Benin of its full support and continued cooperation as we work together, as brothers and partners, to deepen democracy and ensure lasting peace and prosperity for our peoples and the entire West African region.” A second statement by ECOWAS Commission highlighted action taken to forestall democracy in Benin Republic. The statement read: “Further to its earlier statement on the Republic of Benin, the ECOWAS Commission hereby informs the general public that : 1.Persuant to the provisions of relevant ECOWAS instruments, in particular Article 25(e) of the 1999 Protocol Relating to the Mechanism for Conflict Prevention, Management, Resolution Peacekeeping and Security, and 2.after consultation among members of the Mediation and Security Council at the level of Heads of State and Government, a. The Chair of ECOWAS Authority of Heads of state and Government has ordered the deployment of elements of the ECOWAS Standby Force to the Republic of Benin with immediate effect. b. The Regional Force shall be made up of troops from the Federal Republic of Nigeria, Republic of Sierra Leone, Republic of Cote Divoire, and Republic of Ghana. c. The Force shall support the Government and the Republican Army of Benin to preserve constitutional order and the territorial integrity of the Republic of Benin.”
summary: Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) Commission has deployed a standby force in Benin Republic to forestall breakdown of law and order . Deployment followed the unsuccessfully attempt by a faction of the military to oust President Patrice Tallon in the early hours of Sunday .

title: Chelsea handed latest injury blow as Liam Delap return timeline revealed
text: Chelsea striker Liam Delap is reportedly set for another lengthy spell on the sidelines after he picked up a shoulder injury in the 0-0 draw with Bournemouth. Delap was handed his second successive Premier League start on Saturday as Enzo Maresca’s side travelled to the south coast. However, the striker’s match lasted little more than 30 minutes after he landed awkwardly on his shoulder following a duel with Marcos Senesi. The Englishman was subsequently replaced by Marc Guiu, using his match shirt as a makeshift sling as he made his way off the pitch in clear discomfort. Speaking after the game, Maresca hinted that the early signs were not positive for Delap, telling reporters: ‘Unfortunately he was already out for two months and he has to be out again. Punchy analysis, transfer talk and more from Metro's football experts sent straight to your inbox – sign up, it's an open goal. ‘We don’t know for how long, but it looks quite bad, his shoulder.’ And talkSPORT are now reporting that Delap tore his shoulder ligaments in the fall and could be facing up to eight weeks out with the injury. The news will be a bitter blow for the striker, who signed for £30million from Ipswich Town over the summer but has endured a tough start to life at Stamford Bridge. Delap missed almost two months of action due to a hamstring injury which he sustained in the third league game of the season against Fulham. The striker made his return in late October against Wolves, but his cameo off the bench lasted only 26 minutes before he was sent off following a second yellow card. Atalanta vs Chelsea (Champions League, December 9) Chelsea vs Everton (Premier League, December 13) Cardiff vs Chelsea (Carabao Cup, December 16) Newcastle vs Chelsea (Premier League, December 20) Chelsea vs Aston Villa (Premier League, December 27) Chelsea vs Bournemouth (Premier League, December 30) Manchester City vs Chelsea (Premier League, January 4) The 22-year-old did get his first goal for the club in last month’s impressive 3-0 win over Barcelona in the Champions League. But Delap is still yet to get off the mark for the Blues in the league, having scored 12 times for Ipswich under Kieran McKenna last season. With Delap out injured, Joao Pedro and Guiu are Maresca’s two centre forward options, althogh the Italian has deployed Pedro Neto centrally in recent weeks. Chelsea are in desperate need of a positive result after a midweek defeat to Leeds United and a goalless draw with Bournemouth at the weekend. The Blues currently sit fifth and eight points of league leaders Arsenal, but have a tricky upcoming fixture list over the busy festive period. Maresca’s side travel to face Atalanta in the Champions League before a home league game against Everton and a trip to Cardiff in the Carabao Cup quarter-finals. But after that, Chelsea face a tough run against Newcastle, Aston Villa, Bournemouth and Manchester City in the space of just 16 days over the Christmas and New Year period. For more stories like this, check our sport page. Follow Metro Sport for the latest news on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Arrow MORE: Michael Owen and Danny Murphy make feelings clear on Mo Salah outburst Arrow MORE: Why Daniel Munoz is not playing for Crystal Palace against Fulham today Arrow MORE: Paul Scholes has a pop at Arsenal legend over commentary style Punchy analysis, transfer talk and more from Metro's football experts, sent straight to your inbox every week. Let us know which team you support. Close This site is protected by reCAPTCHA and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply. Your information will be used in line with our Privacy Policy
summary: Liam Delap picked up a shoulder injury in Chelsea's 0-0 draw with Bournemouth . The 22-year-old landed awkwardly on his shoulder in the first half of the game . The Chelsea striker was replaced by Marc Guiu after 30 minutes . Enzo Maresca said Delap was already out for two months and he has to be out again .

title: Chargers' Justin Herbert shares bold take on playing through injury vs. Eagles
text: Los Angeles Chargers quarterback Justin Herbert will attempt to play the hero by playing one week removed from surgery when his team hosts the Philadelphia Eagles on the Week 14 edition of Monday Night Football. Easier said than done. Herbert suffered a fracture in his non-throwing hand in Week 13 and will be almost exactly one week removed from surgery when the Chargers-Eagles encounter kicks off under primetime lights. Still, Herbert has oozed confidence and optimism all week. Cast-glove hybrid protecting him, the Chargers quarterback was a regular at practice, albeit with limited under-center work. RELATED: NFL fines multiple Raiders for actions against the Chargers but not for egregious hit Asked about how playing with a cast might impact him, Herbert said he’s hoping things take a business-as-usual approach. “I try to play the game the same way,” Herbert said. “As long as it’s stabilized and fixed, you know, the doctors feel comfortable with it, then I think you can just move on to just playing and just try not to focus on it too much.” There have been some rumblings about backup Trey Lance entering the game in short-yardage situations because of Herbert’s ability to take a snap from under center in those scenarios. RELATED: Chargers coach gives Eagles a little confusing bulletin-board material before Week 14 Whether Lance sees the field at all, though, remains to be seen. And if everything else is business as usual for Herbert, ideally, they’d like to prevent short-yardage situations while putting up a healthy dose of points, anyway. There’s also hope that the expected return of first-rounder running back Omarion Hampton to pair with the effective Kimani Vidal will help the Chargers dominate the game script and ask very little of Herbert, anyway. Herbert is in luck, though. Names like Josh Allen of the Buffalo Bills have played chunks of seasons in recent years with similar injuries to non-throwing hands and done just fine. Similar to yesterday, Justin Herbert was being handed the ball in today’s #Chargers practice when aligning under center. No issues catching the snap in shotgun. pic.twitter.com/SzyIyKFGqh That won’t reduce the stress levels of Chargers fans much if Herbert takes a hit or extends a play with his feet and puts himself at risk. But some of the past proof from other quarterbacks is encouraging and, in the end, he’s right: Doctors cleared him. Herbert and the Chargers view it as worth the risk, regardless: A win would send them to 9-4 and keep them in the thick of the wild card hunt, while the Denver Broncos currently lead the AFC West at 10-2. — Enjoy free coverage of the Chargers from Los Angeles Chargers on SI — Sign Up For the Chargers Daily Digest - OnSI’s Free Los Angeles Chargers Newsletter Chargers rookie Oronde Gadsden accused of impacting critical $17.5 million decision Chargers predicted to ‘bludgeon’ Eagles in front of primetime audience Omarion Hampton set for Week 14 return after Chargers roster moves Chargers shockingly named as suitor for controversial star free agent WR Week 14 rooting guide as Chargers hope for help in strengthening playoff position Chris Roling has covered the NFL since 2010 with stints at Bleacher Report, USA TODAY Sports Media Group and others. Raised a Bengals fan in the '90s, the Andy Dalton era was smooth sailing by comparison. He graduated from the E. W. Scripps School of Journalism at Ohio University and remains in Athens.
summary: Los Angeles Chargers quarterback Justin Herbert suffered a fracture in his non-throwing hand in Week 13 . The Chargers quarterback was a regular at practice, albeit with limited under-center work . Herbert said he's hoping things take a business-as-usual approach .

title: Colonel On The Run, It’s Game Over
text: • Security forces arrest some of his men as dragnet widens By PHC Telegraph The leader of the mutineers who attempted to seize power in Benin Republic, Colonel Pascal Tigri, is on the run. Tigri has not been seen since after the coup-day-broadcast, but there are strong indications that a massive manhunt which may lead to his eventual arrest has been launched. It is not clear if the coup leader has slipped out of the country. Loyal troops, according to reports that are trickling in, are combing the entire country in a bid to apprehend the fugitive who has gone underground. So far, some of his associates have been arrested and credible sources believe it may be a matter of time before he is taken into custody. The Nigerian authorities are keenly monitoring the situation in that country. Nigeria views military takeovers in the ECOWAS sub region as an aberration. It is quite obvious, at least for now, that the coup has failed following the swift intervention of the nation’s defence and security forces. Alassane Seidou, Benin’s Interior Minister has surfaced on national TV to say the coup has been crushed. “Early on Sunday morning, 7 December 2025”, Seidou disclosed, “a small group of soldiers launched a mutiny aimed at destabilising the state and its institutions. “Faced with this situation, the Beninese armed forces and their leadership, true to their oath, remained committed to the republic. Their response allowed them to retain control of the situation and foil the attempt. “The government therefore urges the population to go about their activities as normal’.”
summary: Colonel Pascal Tigri has not been seen since after the coup-day-broadcast . There are strong indications that a massive manhunt which may lead to his eventual arrest has been launched . Some of his associates have been arrested and credible sources believe it may be a matter of time before he is taken into custody .

title: Households urged to check for rare bank notes with 1 small detail worth fortune
text: Since many households would be struggling with the cost of living crisis, it's no wonder Brits will be on the hunt for money-saving methods ahead of Christmas. Whether you want to sell any old kids' toys or clothes, did it occur to you that your money could be worth, well, loads of money? Now the experts at Playcasion.com, a leading online comparison platform, revealed the bank notes which are worth thousands of pounds. Research found you could earn the most money if your bank notes have the following three details: On the original plastic £5, experts highlight the earliest AA01 notes. Meanwhile at a Bank of England charity auction, the lowest serial number available in circulation – AA01 000017 – sold for £4,150, with other AA01 notes also selling for loads. When the Jane Austen polymer £10 launched, an AA01 000010 note went for £7,200, and other early AA01 Austen £10 notes fetched similar four-figure sums, underlining just how keen collectors are to own the first notes off the press. Meanwhile Instagram user @CoinCollectingWizard always urges households to keep an eye on their change after that £10 note has been seen to flog for over £3,000. Analysis also suggests the really serious money comes when AK47 is combined with a "fancy" pattern in the digits: a serial like AK47 747474 has been reported selling for around £13,000, while another fiver with all six digits the same – for example 555555 – has allegedly drawn offers in excess of £3,000. AA01 000017 – £5 polymer (Churchill): Lowest serial available to the public from the first polymer £5 release; sold at a Bank of England charity auction for £4,150. AA01 000007 – £5 polymer (Churchill): One of the very first polymer fivers printed; widely reported as selling for over £20,000 at auction. AK47 747474 – £5 polymer: "Gun-code" AK47 prefix plus a repeating 74 pattern; reported eBay sale around £13,000. (Any prefix) 555555 – £5 polymer: All six digits identical; one such fiver with 555555 has reportedly attracted offers above £3,000. AA01 000010 – £10 polymer (Jane Austen): Early Jane Austen £10 from the first AA01 run; sold at Spink for £7,200. HB01 000002 – £10 King Charles III: Ultra-low serial from the first run of Charles tenners; hammered for £17,000 at auction. Sheet of 40 × £50 AJ01 – King Charles III: Connected sheet of forty £50 notes with first-prefix AJ01 serials; sold for £26,000 (face value £2,000).
summary: Experts at Playcasion.com, a leading online comparison platform, revealed the bank notes which are worth thousands of pounds . Research found you could earn the most money if your bank notes have three details . Lowest serial number available in circulation – AA01 000017 – sold for £4,150 at a Bank of England charity auction . AK47 747474 – £5 polymer: "Gun-code" AK47 prefix plus repeating 74 pattern; reported eBay sale around £13,000 .

title: Florida: 58-year-old woman killed in a golf cart accident driven by her Greek-American husband
text: A 58-year-old woman, Christina Theodosiou, died in Florida, USA, about a week ago when she fell from a golf cart driven by her 64-year-old husband. According to Law and Crime, Angelo Theodosiou was arrested and charged with driving under the influence of alcohol and refusing to submit to police checks, while he claims through his lawyer that he was not drunk and did not cause the accident. According to an arrest report from the St. Johns County Sheriff’s Office, the accident occurred around 10:45 p.m. on the evening of November 30, when Angelo Theodosiou was allegedly driving a golf cart with his wife as a passenger. During the ride, the 58-year-old woman fell from the vehicle and was seriously injured. “The victim, the defendant’s wife, hit her head on the ground and was airlifted by helicopter to Jacksonville Memorial Hospital with a grade 3 on the Glasgow scale during air ambulance transport.” A short time later, Christina Theodosiou succumbed to her injuries. Authorities recorded that the driver was deemed at fault (“at fault driver”) for the incident. Angelo Theodosiou was arrested and taken to the St. Johns County Jail; however, authorities say he was released on bail on December 1, one day after his arrest. His next scheduled court appearance is set for January 6, 2026. The arrest report states that the officers handling the case found evidence of alcohol consumption, including the 64-year-old’s red eyes and the odour of an alcoholic beverage which they could smell on him from three feet away in an open area. At the same time, it was reported that although the man knew that a driving under the influence of alcohol (DUI) investigation was underway, he nevertheless refused to submit to a standardized sobriety test. “After being taken into custody, the defendant repeatedly asked what was going on and why he was being arrested,” the report added. The 64-year-old has been charged with driving under the influence of alcohol and refusing to submit to police checks. According to the same document, while he initially allegedly agreed to submit to a breathalyzer test, he later changed his attitude. Through his attorney, Angelo Theodosiou denies the charges and maintains that he was not under the influence of alcohol nor did he cause the crash. “My client maintains his innocence, and we look forward to receiving the evidence,” his attorney, L. Lee Lockett, told the local St. Johns Citizen website. “He did not cause the accident; he was not under the influence of alcohol,” he added. The Greek-American’s attorney also noted that the 64-year-old is “devastated” by the death of his wife. The couple had moved to Florida from New York, where Theodosiou had run a restaurant in Queens for many years. According to local reports, family members of the couple say they “stand by” the defendant. Explore related questions
summary: Christina Theodosiou, 58, died in Florida, USA, about a week ago when she fell from a golf cart driven by her husband . The 64-year-old has been charged with driving under the influence of alcohol and refusing to submit to police checks . Authorities recorded that the driver was deemed at fault (“at fault driver”) for the incident .

title: The worst habits for your back, according to a chiropractor
text: From poor posture to sitting too long, our daily habits and movements can all contribute to an achy and weak back. But according to a chiropractor, with three intentional daily practices, you can maintain a healthy back and prevent any further issues from developing. "Align daily. Move often. Support your nervous system," recommends Dr Sherry McAllister, a certified chiropractic sports physician and President of the Foundation for Chiropractic Progress (F4CP). The chiropractor says that your back is "an information highway" that supports your body in a number of ways, so it is important to take care of it. "It is how we view our back that will make all the difference. Your back isn’t just a structure of bones, ligaments and muscles, it’s an information highway. When your spine is aligned, your nervous system performs at its best, helping you move, think, breathe, digest and recover more efficiently," Dr McAllister explains. "The nervous system is so incredibly important that it has its own protective barrier to trauma: the vertebrae. Yet, insults can impact its alignment, creating a slower, less optimal performance. Now that we can see how delicate it is, you should take a moment to reflect on the a-e, if you are really taking care of this amazing system." "A check-in with a DC is a powerful way to optimise your health. Prevention begins with alignment. Seeing your chiropractor before pain or injury allows you to identify potential issues early, often the small, silent imbalances created by everyday habits. During your visit, your chiropractor evaluates areas such as ergonomics, gait, posture, balance, flexibility and range of motion, to name a few. "These elements reveal how well your body is functioning and where stress may be accumulating. Poor function often develops quietly over time. Chiropractic care helps to restore balance to the spine and nervous system - an essential foundation of whole-being care." "Sitting for more than 45 minutes slows blood flow, tightens hip flexors, weakens stabilisers and can create stress on your spine and its three natural curves," the chiropractor says. "The spine depends on these stabilisers. Even five minutes of glute bridges, bird dogs, side planks or walking can make a big difference in preventing injury." Focusing on small movements every day is important for maintaining a healthy back. "How you lift, sit, text, breathe, and even carry a bag affects your back. Small choices stack up, positively or negatively," says the author of Adjusted Reality: Supercharge Your Whole-being for Optimal Living and Longevity. Meanwhile, everything from your sleeping position to your bedding are also worth considering for the sake of your back health. "A supportive mattress, neutral sleep position, and consistent schedule restore the stress to the spine. Equally important is your pillow. The right pillow should support the natural curve of your neck, keeping your head in a neutral position - not flexed forward, tilted back, or rotated," Dr McAllister says. "When your pillow maintains that gentle C-shaped cervical curve, it reduces strain on the spine, relaxes surrounding muscles, improves breathing and allows your nervous system to reset more effectively. This small shift can dramatically improve sleep quality, reduce morning stiffness, and support your whole-being alignment." Everything from the position of your office chair to your choice of handbag can contribute to back pain - something which Dr McAllister calls "micro-misalignments". "It’s the 'micro-misalignments' that build into macro-problems. Everyday habits can quietly pull your body out of alignment, creating a cascade of effects on your spine and nervous system. Sitting too long at a desk slowly reverses the lumbar curve, overloading the discs while weakening the glutes and tightening the hip flexors. Add in the weight of a heavy or one-shoulder bag, and the spine absorbs uneven loading that rotates the shoulders and strains the upper body," she says. "The familiar 'Laptop Lean,' even a two-inch forward head tilt, can triple the demand on the neck and upper back, while poor sleep posture twists joints and compresses soft tissues throughout the night. Stress compounds the issue; shallow breathing tightens the upper back, shifting posture before you’re even aware it’s happening. And when inactivity settles in, stabilisers weaken, and circulation slows, making movement feel heavier than it should." A weak lower back may not always present with back pain; you may experience stiffness and pain elsewhere in the body, as the chiropractor explains: "Signs of a weakened lower back often appear quietly, revealing themselves through tight hip flexors and hamstrings as surrounding muscles work overtime to compensate for a core that isn’t fully stabilising. "You may notice a swayback or a tucked pelvis - subtle shifts in alignment that immediately reflect how well the spine is being supported. Fatigue while simply standing or walking can follow, because a strong and balanced back should hold you with effortless ease." She adds: "Morning stiffness becomes more frequent as the spine struggles to regain overnight support, and everyday movements such as bending, lifting or rotating, may begin to feel unsteady or uncertain. Even long periods of sitting can trigger recurring aches, a signal that your stabilising muscles are tiring more quickly than they should. "These are all quiet messages from a system whose operating intelligence is superior to any other found on Earth: your body is asking for alignment, strength and attention so it can return to its natural state of balance." Along with maintaining good posture and keeping active, you can also support a healthy spine and back through your diet. There are some key vitamins that are beneficial for bone health - many of which you can get through a balanced and varied diet, but that you may wish to supplement as an additional measure for a healthy body. "Supporting spinal health begins with nourishing the body in ways that reinforce its natural strength, flexibility and mobility. Therefore, what you eat becomes a vital part of how healthy your body is. Bone health is key: Vitamin D3 plays a vital role in bone integrity and inflammation control, an especially important nutrient given how many people spend long hours indoors. The combination of Vitamin K2 with D3 ensures calcium is guided into the bones where it belongs, helping fortify the spine," says Dr McAllister. "Magnesium works hand-in-hand with the nervous system, aiding muscle relaxation, nerve conduction, and easing the tension that often accumulates through stress or prolonged sitting. Omega-3 fatty acids provide powerful anti-inflammatory benefits to the discs and joints. Collagen paired with Vitamin C supports the connective tissues, ligaments and discs that allow the spine to move and absorb impact." However, the expert warns that nutrition alone isn't enough to maintain a healthy back. "Yet in whole-being health, nutrition is only one part of the equation. No vitamin can replace the benefits of movement, alignment and a well-regulated nervous system; together, they form the true foundation for a spine that supports your best life." One of the life stages where a woman's back can really suffer is during pregnancy, with the additional weight and stretching ligaments often causing discomfort and contributing to back pain. However, gentle exercise like yoga may help, along with prenatal chiropractic care. "Pregnancy is a profound season of transformation, and supporting the mother’s alignment, comfort and nervous-system balance is essential for both her health and the baby’s development. Prenatal chiropractic care uses safe, gentle adjustments to align the pelvis, reduce nerve tension and maintain the natural curves that support a growing belly," says Dr McAllister. "Movement becomes medicine during this time: pelvic tilts, cat/cow, side-lying leg lifts, walking and prenatal yoga help stabilise the core and pelvis as the centre of gravity shifts. Sleep positioning also plays a vital role; resting on the left side with support under the belly and between the knees reduces lumbar stress and promotes circulation." You may also find that focusing on breathwork and avoiding any additional strain can help to ease pregnancy back pain. "Warm compresses combined with gentle movement relax tight tissues, while hydration and prenatal vitamins help minimise cramps and muscle tension. Because pregnancy already shifts pelvic mechanics, avoiding heavy bags and uneven loads prevents unnecessary strain," the chiropractor shares. "And throughout it all, deep diaphragmatic breathing becomes a powerful tool - supporting the pelvic floor, calming the nervous system and creating a peaceful, aligned internal environment where both mother and baby can thrive."
summary: Dr Sherry McAllister says that your back is "an information highway" that supports your body in a number of ways . Your back isn’t just a structure of bones, ligaments and muscles, it’s an information highway . When your spine is aligned, your nervous system performs at its best .

title: Alum Bret Johnsen, SpaceX CFO, talks with Trojans about space innovation and the USC network
text: Dean’s Dialogue: SpaceX CFO Bret Johnsen on Space Innovation and the Trojan Network Dean Geoffrey Garrett and Bret Johnsen discuss SpaceX innovations and Trojan connections. [USC Photo / David Sprague] Dean’s Dialogue: SpaceX CFO Bret Johnsen on Space Innovation and the Trojan Network Bret Johnsen, a Leventhal alumnus, spoke with Marshall Dean Geoffrey Garrett about SpaceX’s cutting-edge projects, U.S. manufacturing, and the value of a USC education. Bret Johnsen, CFO of SpaceX and an alumnus of the USC Leventhal School of Accounting, joined Marshall Dean Geoffrey Garrett for a wide-ranging “Dean’s Dialogue” discussion on emerging technologies, radical innovation, and Trojan connections. A proud alumnus, Johnsen is also a newly appointed member of the USC Board of Trustees and the father of two Trojans. Speaking directly to the families attending Trojan Family Weekend, the CFO provided insights into the value of a USC education and the Trojan Network. “I’m a perfect example of what I want for my kids and for all of your kids, which is to find your path and be given the opportunity along the way to decide what that path is,” Johnsen said. “USC does an amazing job — did then and still does, even probably better now — of making sure that everyone is coming here to recruit your kids.” Johnsen’s path to SpaceX took a circuitous route. Originally an auditor for Coopers & Lybrand, he pivoted into a career with technology companies Broadcom and Mindspeed Technologies, where he quickly rose through the ranks. He attributes that success to a willingness to experiment and take on any job, advice he passes along to students. “When I was at Broadcom … I rotated through the company and probably took four or five different jobs in my nine years there,” Johnsen said. “When the corporate controller (principal accounting officer) role came up, the reason I got the job was because I knew more about the company than anybody else because I’d done that rotation. So push yourself, challenge yourself, and take rotations when you can.” In 2011, Johnsen was approached by a little known company named SpaceX which he initially assumed was a storage company based on the name. He soon learned it was an aerospace company, and despite admitting to the recruiter that his space knowledge began and ended with Star Wars, Johnsen took the job and has now worked for SpaceX for 14 years. The company’s work transcends multiple sectors, from space transportation and reusable rockets to planetary exploration and their internet service, Starlink. In 2025, SpaceX is projected to earn $15.5 billion in revenue, surpassing NASA’s projected 2026 budget. Despite its size, Johnsen said the company’s private status has allowed it to stay nimble and take chances other companies couldn’t afford. “If you come in [to SpaceX], you would feel like you’re in a startup,” Johnsen said. “It’s a 17,000 person startup. And that makes us incredibly nimble. It allows us to take risks.” USC has been one of our top two or three target schools for many, many years at SpaceX. — Bret Johnsen CFO, SpaceX / Leventhal Alumnus One such risk has been in reusable rockets, developed to decrease costs, increase flights, and potentially democratize space travel. Johnsen reflected on multiple disastrous and highly publicized take-offs that could have tanked a publicly traded company. Being private, however, has enabled SpaceX to support experimentation in the spirit of innovation. “It’s okay to take risks,” Johnsen said. “That responsible engineer on the floor … feels that and is able to make those decisions. I think that empowerment has been really special for us.” SpaceX’s location sparks special interest for USC families. The company was founded in Los Angeles where it remains to this day. Johnsen has used the proximity to connect with USC students and provide tours of the company factory. “It’s easy for someone like me to actually come and work with your students,” Johnsen said. “I’ve actually had student groups come to SpaceX and see the factory where we’re building satellites and rockets.” Johnsen knows better than anyone the quality of Trojan alumni, demonstrated by the numerous opportunities at SpaceX for USC graduates. “USC has been one of our top two or three target schools for many, many years at SpaceX,” Johnsen said. “I think we are one of the most attractive places to go for kids, and that’s simply because I personally know how great the education is here … If you look at what will differentiate in a very tough market, it will be top schools.” When given a chance to ask questions, one Trojan parent asked the CFO what he looks for in new hires. He had a simple answer: "You're looking for someone who has the great skill sets that they get here at USC,” Johnsen said. RELATED Cited: Richard Sloan in Bloomberg Tax Sloan’s research shows that financial auditing and accounting cases usually decline during the first year of a new presidential administration as new division directors are hired. Interview: Paul Orlando in Beta Boom Orlando explains how he and the Greif Incubator support founders at USC Marshall. Marshall Faculty Publications, Awards, and Honors: November 2025 We are proud to highlight the many accomplishments of Marshall’s exceptional faculty recognized for recently accepted and published research and achievements in their field. Quoted: Nick Vyas in ABC7 In the wake of a major cargo spill and massive container ship fire, Vyas explains how early shipment of goods helped Los Angeles and Long Beach ports absorb the supply chain shock. Forbes 30 Under 30 Entrepreneur Shares His Journey from Business School to Startup Success Bobby Pinckney ’20 is creating impact with innovative technological ventures and inspiring new Trojans to shape the future.
summary: Bret Johnsen is the CFO of SpaceX and an alumnus of the USC Leventhal School of Accounting . He spoke with Marshall Dean Geoffrey Garrett about SpaceX’s cutting-edge projects, U.S. manufacturing, and the value of a USC education . Johnsen attributes success to a willingness to experiment and take on any job .

title: Asking Eric: Can mom work through tension in son’s relationship with dad so they can celebrate special birthday?
text: Dear Eric: My son is turning 40 on December 22. My husband and I are at a quandary as to how to celebrate him. There have been issues between my husband and him over things from his childhood. We did a special trip for his older brother when he turned 40 and would like to do something special for this son’s 40th as well. Our daughter-in-law has made special plans for him and we are not included. I understand that, but I need some ideas as to how to celebrate this extra special year without rocking the boat. I love my son with all my heart, as I do all my children, and want his 40th birthday to be memorable in a positive way. Any suggestions? – Mom Who Wants to Celebrate Dear Mom: The issues your son and your husband are having may be an obstacle, but they aren’t insurmountable. And the thing that can get them on the path to resolution is the same thing that can get you answers about how to celebrate your son: open communication. It’s not within your purview to try to fix things between them, but you have your own relationship with your son and so I’d encourage you to reach out and tell him what you told me: you want to celebrate him, you know things are difficult, and you’re looking for options. This is deceptively simple and it’s something that all of us so often neglect to do. It can feel awkward to acknowledge tension in a relationship or to ask someone what they want or how they want to feel valued, but that kind of vulnerability is the cornerstone of healthy communication. Your son may not have a concrete idea about what you can do to celebrate him; that’s OK, too. But by bringing it up, you introduce the idea that you want to celebrate him, that he’s important to you, and that you’re putting his needs first here. That’s going to go a long way. Your celebration with your son may not end up happening for the actual 40 th birthday, but by laying the groundwork now, you keep the lines of communication open for a meaningful celebration when everyone is ready. Send questions to R. Eric Thomas at eric@askingeric.com or P.O. Box 22474, Philadelphia, PA 19110. Follow him on Instagram and sign up for his weekly newsletter at rericthomas.com. R. Eric Thomas (he/him) is a national bestselling author, playwright, and screenwriter. His memoir, Here for It, or How to Save Your Soul in America, which Lin-Manuel Miranda hailed as “pop culture-obsessed,... more
summary: Dear Eric: My son is turning 40 on December 22 . There have been issues between my husband and him over things from his childhood . My daughter-in-law has made special plans for him and we are not included . I need some ideas as to how to celebrate this extra special year without rocking the boat .
